nodes.bodyText: It's not exclusively laziness that I didn't make this path use pooled bytes now as well. Caching here turned out to be somewhat bogus in practice and needs to be changed (will do over the next few days when I find some time). I just went with the simplest possible change here for now as it doesn't really matter.

Creating the serialized repo data to cache here early is a win even without pooled buffers for the serialization. It wasn't necessary to keep the uncompressed version around for the duration of the below cluster state update.
This is especially true when it turns out to be very large (as in multiple MB or so) and won't be cached to begin with.
Gotta do the non-closing copy here and close the in via try because we can only close out once (multiple closes aren't idempotent and trip assertions.
+1, bytes() should not be used once ReleasableBytesStreamOutput is closed
But InputStream in is part of the try-with-resources so it should align with the ReleasableBytesStreamOutput out above it shouldn't it?
Raaah yes, I misread this line :( Sorry for the noise.
